nning JUnit,

ract it to a directory.( for me it is d:\)

>got to =
the home directory of JUnit.

>Then set the cla=
sspath as,

No need for =
src.jar on the CLASSPATH.

>
>Then run to see whether all is set by running=
.
>
>java java junit.tests.AllTests
>
>Now you should see something like th=
is:
>

et for executing JUnit.

No need to put them in the system classpath. They =
only need to be on the classpath when you launch the Java interpreter.
